decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.

<p>Prior to works commencing, the position, type and method of installation of all new and relocated services including details of all drainage and plumbing services for each floor plan and an appraisal how the proposal will impact on any historic fabric (including detail of any new notching of beams, perforations to walls, floors and ceilings or boxing-in), shall be specified and agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority wherever these installations are to be visible, or where ducts or other methods of concealment are proposed. </p><p>The works shall be implemented only in accordance with such approval.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building&nbsp;</p>

<p>No permission is granted for any new plumbing, pipes, soil stacks, flues, vents, ductwork, grilles, security alarms, lighting, cameras or other appurtenances fixed to any external faces of the building unless shown on the drawings hereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building&nbsp;</p>

<p>All existing historic features including, but not limited to, chimney pieces, grates, plasterwork, joinery, architraves, and staircase balustrading shall remain undisturbed in their existing position and shall be fully protected during the course of works on site, unless specifically authorised otherwise on the drawings hereby approved.&nbsp; The development and works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building&nbsp;</p>

<p>Notwithstanding the hereby approved plans, prior to the commencement of the relevant part of works,&nbsp; details of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:</p><ul><li>Details of doors at 1:20 scale showing proposed cross section and 1:5 drawing of the panelling profile</li><li>Details of proposed paint for external render including colour and manufacturer&nbsp;</li><li>1:20 elevations of the proposed windows showing the pane pattern and 1:5 sections showing the materials, glazing bars, frames and glazing units. The window units shall be 12mm width maximum (4mm glass, 4mm gap, 4mm glass) with integral glazing bars and a putty finish to replicate the detailing of the existing windows.</li></ul><p>The works shall be implemented only in accordance with such approval.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building&nbsp;<br></p>
description: Internal alterations including partition walls and doors, replacement of existing sash windows.
